- managed database service
- [[PostgreSQL]], [[SQL]] or [[MySQL]]
- HA across Zones
	- replications are read replicas
	- can have read replicas across
		- zones
		- regions
		- or to on prem
	- requirements
		- auto backup enabled
			- binary logging enabled
				- point-in-time recovery enabled
		- one backup created since binary logging was enabled
	- can promote read only replicas to the main database
		- cannot be undone
		- other read replicas need to be reattached to the new leader
		- #+BEGIN_TIP
		  HA already uses failovers for the database and then fails back to original, so only use database promotion for 
		  regional migration (planned)
		  disaster recovery (unplanned)
		  #+END_TIP
		- an HA configured instance is billed at double the rate
- backups
	- by default, stores backup data in two regions: same region and alt
	- on demand backups
	- automated backups
		- 4 hour backup window
		- schedule them when they have the least traffic
	- point-in-time recovery
		- always creates a new instance
- uses (up to) 30TB same-zone [[GCP Persistent Disk]]s
- security
	- encryption at rest and transit
- billed on
	- instance
	- persistent disk
	- egress traffic
- Available on
	- shared core db-f1-micro, db-g1-small
	- standard db-n1-standard-1 > 96
	- high memory db-n1-highmem-2 > 96
-
- recommended method of access is Cloud SQL Proxy
	- like a bastion node
-
